Activity: Arrive at the office. Grab a coffee and check emails. See if I have any new email.
Review feedback from @Ldes-1 on the enemy encounter. Address any concerns or suggestions.
Continue refining the enemy encounter based on feedback. Focus on polish and balancing. Make sure the encounter is challenging but fair, and that it feels good to play.
Start prototyping a different gameplay scenario: puzzle design. Design a simple environmental puzzle that requires the player to manipulate objects in the environment to progress.
Lunch break. Get some food with colleagues.
Implement the puzzle in the level. Add the necessary objects, triggers, and interactions.
Test the puzzle. Make sure it's solvable but not too easy. Adjust the difficulty as needed.

Add more visual elements to the level. Start with set dressing. Add props and details to make the environment feel more believable and lived-in. Email @3dmod-1 to ask about the prop information.@3dmod-1 Subject:Prop information of the Game.
Back up work and write a summary of progress. Send email to @Ldes-1 with update and ask for feedback on puzzle design.
